title: Authors and Citation
text: Elian Thiele-Evans. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Thiele-Evans E (2023). rsx: Create Encapsulated Shiny Components. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://elianhugh.github.io/rsx/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rsx: Create Encapsulated Shiny Components},   author = {Elian Thiele-Evans},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://elianhugh.github.io/rsx/}, }

title: Create Encapsulated Shiny Components
text: rsx R package creating complex yet manageable Shiny applications nestable components encapsulate UI state. heavily inspired many JavaScript frameworks, particularly Vue. Features: Nestable modular templating system Scoped CSS isolate styles components Automatic namespacing (think shiny modules)

title: Create Encapsulated Shiny Components
text: writing Shiny apps, managing relationship module server module UI can challenging, leading cognitive overhead confusion. rsx, module servers UI always coupled one object, simplifying process creating managing Shiny modules.

title: Create Encapsulated Shiny Components
code: install.packages('rsx', repos = 'https://elianhugh.r-universe.dev')

title: Create Encapsulated Shiny Components
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ElianHugh/rsx")

title: Create Encapsulated Shiny Components
text: use rsx, define components functions component function. Components can data, template, styles, methods, making fully encapsulated reusable. defined, can use components Shiny app rsx_app function. information define use components rsx, please see package documentation pkgdown site.
code: library(rsx)  counter <- component(     name = "counter",     data = function() {         list(             label = "Counter #1",             count = reactiveVal(0L)         )     },     template = function(ns) {         tagList(             actionButton(ns("button"), label = self$label),             verbatimTextOutput(ns("out"))         )     },     methods = list(         setup = function(input, output, session) {             observeEvent(input$button, {                 self$count(                     self$count() + 1L                 )             })             output$out <- renderText(                 self$count()             )         }     ) )  rsx_app(counter)

title: Component Data — component-data
text: Data used component's internal state can also used pass information parent component children. component templates methods access component data.

title: Component Data — component-data
text: create component data, define function returns list named objects. objects can Shiny reactive objects, data frames, lists, R object. instance, following valid data function:
code: function() {  list(    rctv = shiny::reactiveVal(),    df   = mtcars  ) }

title: Component Data — component-data
text: Data can accessed methods template parts component via self keyword. example, following component defines data foo, accesses template via self$foo.
code: x <- component(     data = function() {         list(             foo = 1L         )     },     template = function(ns) {         self$foo     } )  print(x()) #> <rsx::instance> `unnamed_component-NG48820qm` #> 1

title: Component Data — component-data
text: pass data component, use data argument calling component function. data argument list named objects match names objects defined component's data function. example:
code: x <- component(     data = function() {         list(             foo = 1L         )     },     template = function(ns) {         self$foo     } )  print(x(data = list(foo = 2L))) #> <rsx::instance> `unnamed_component-NI65459ml` #> 2

title: Component Methods — component-methods
text: Methods list functions contained within given component, typically manipulate component data respond user input. Methods can accessed methods component template via self keyword.

title: Component Methods — component-methods
text: Methods defined component definition named list functions. example, following method section simple counter component defines two methods, setup increment, respectively set module server increment count state:
code: methods = list(     setup = function(input, output, session) {         output$txt <- renderText({             paste0("Count is: ", self$count())         })         observeEvent(input$button, {             self$count(self$count() + 1L)         })     },     increment = function() {         self$count(self$count() + 1L)     } )

title: Component Methods — component-methods
text: setup hook defined passing function named "setup" methods list. Setup used module server component. method called module first initialized, used set input/output bindings necessary initialization code.
code: setup = function(input, output, session) {  }

title: Component Methods — component-methods
text: render hook defined passing function named "render" methods list. render hook allows modification template code prior rendering.
code: render = function(element) {  }

title: Component Styles — component-styles
text: styles argument character vector length 1 defines styles component. Styles scoped component.

title: Component Styles — component-styles
text: styles argument takes character vector length 1 defines styles component. example:   define CSS styles anchor elements (<>) component, setting color red. Styles defined way scoped component, meaning apply elements within component.
code: styles = "a { color: red; }"

title: Component Template — component-template
text: template refers UI-generator given component. analagous UI function given shiny module.

title: Component Template — component-template
text: component template function must following structure (note ns argument):   following example valid template:
code: function(ns) {  # must either return an object that can  # be coerced to a `shiny::tags` object or a `shiny::tagList` } function(ns) {  shiny::div("Hello world!") }

title: Component Template — component-template
text: template function requires one argument: ns. ns used identically shiny modules, helps distinguish component instances.

title: Component Template — component-template
text: Component templates can nested use slots. Slots placeholder elements tell rsx tags placed.   can also specify like content used case slot filled -- typically called "fallback" content.
code:
x <- component( template = function(ns) { shiny::tagList( shiny::tags$slot(), shiny::p("bar") ) } ) print(x(shiny::p("foo"))) #> `unnamed_component-AG56110ih` #>

foo

#>

bar

x <- component( template = function(ns) { shiny::tags$slot( shiny::p("Hello!") ) } ) print(x()) #> `unnamed_component-VU98712rn`

title: Component Template — component-template
text: Slots can distinguished name attributes, can used target specific areas template.
code:
x <- component( template = function(ns) { shiny::tagList( shiny::tags$slot(name = "a"), shiny::tags$slot(name = "b") ) } ) print(x(shiny::p("bar", slot = "b"), shiny::p("foo", slot = "a"))) #> `unnamed_component-RQ79050xr` #>

foo

#>

bar

title: Create a component — component
text: Components represent encapsulation shiny module's logic UI singular object, can used like shiny tag. information data, methods, template, styles arguments, see related documentation.

title: Create a component — component
code: component(   name = sprintf("unnamed_component-%s", random_id()),   data = NULL,   methods = NULL,   template = NULL,   styles = NULL )

title: Create a component — component
text: name component name data function returns named list values, used store component's state methods named list functions, define behavior component template function returns taglist styles character vector CSS styles scoped component

title: Create a component — component
code:
library(shiny) counter <- component( name = "counter", data = function() { list( label = "Counter", count = reactiveVal(0L) ) }, template = function(ns) { tagList( actionButton(ns("button"), label = self$label), verbatimTextOutput(ns("out")) ) }, methods = list( setup = function(input, output, session) { observeEvent(input$button, { self$count( self$count() + 1L ) }) output$out <- renderText( self$count() ) } ) ) tagList( tags$h1("Counter"), counter() ) #>

Counter

#> #>

title: Decompose a component instance — decompose
text: Given component instance tag x, decompose instance separate server UI elements.

title: Decompose a component instance — decompose
code: decompose(x)

title: Decompose a component instance — decompose
text: x shiny tag returned calling component

title: Decompose a component instance — decompose
text: list

title: Decompose a component instance — decompose
code:
comp <- component( name = "decompose", template = function(ns) { shiny::div("hello world") }, methods = list( setup = function(input, output, session) { # noop } ) ) x <- decompose(comp()) print(x) #> $server #> function(input, output, session) { #> # noop #> } #> #> #> $ui #> `decompose` #>
hello world
#>

title: Is a component — is.component
text: component

title: Is a component — is.component
code: is.component(x)

title: Is a component — is.component
text: x object

title: Is an instance tag — is.instance_tag
text: instance tag

title: Is an instance tag — is.instance_tag
code: is.instance_tag(x)

title: Is an instance tag — is.instance_tag
text: x object

title: rsx: shiny components — rsx
text: Create complex yet manageable Shiny applications nestable components encapsulate UI state. Heavily inspired many JavaScript frameworks, particularly Vue.

title: rsx: shiny components — rsx
text: rsx package implements encapsulated shiny module server & UI combinations called "components". Main exported methods: making components: component() manipulating components: decompose() loading apps: rsx_app(), rsx_server(), rsx_ui() Website: https://elianhugh.github.io/rsx/

title: rsx: shiny components — rsx
text: Maintainer: Elian Thiele-Evans elianhte@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: Create an rsx app object — rsx_app
title: Create an rsx app object — rsx_app
text: Create new instance rsx application passing top level rsx::component application root. analagous running shiny::shinyApp().

title: Create an rsx app object — rsx_app
code: rsx_app(root, ..., resource_path = NULL, app_class = "App")

title: Create an rsx app object — rsx_app
text: root rsx::component object ... arguments passed shiny::shinyApp resource_path path resource folder, NULL styles inlined app_class html class attribute app wrapper

what: Create an rsx module server — rsx_module_server
title: Create an rsx module server — rsx_module_server
text: rsx_module_server low-level function loads module servers instantiated components. similar rsx_server, also allows namespacing rsx server.

title: Create an rsx module server — rsx_module_server
code: rsx_module_server(id)

title: Create an rsx module server — rsx_module_server
text: id unique namespace

title: Create an rsx server — rsx_server
text: rsx_server low-level function loads module servers instantiated rsx::components. rsx_app function viable shiny application setup, rsx_server function can used.

title: Create an rsx server — rsx_server
code: rsx_server()

title: Create an rsx server — rsx_server
text: shiny server function

title: Create an rsx server — rsx_server
text: things note: Due randomised hashing component namepaces, shiny modules nested rsx component setup function, module server created instance

what: Create an rsx UI taglist — rsx_ui
title: Create an rsx UI taglist — rsx_ui
text: rsx_ui low-level function creating rsx ui without use rsx_app.

title: Create an rsx UI taglist — rsx_ui
code: rsx_ui(root, id = NULL, app_class = "App", resource_path = NULL)

title: Create an rsx UI taglist — rsx_ui
text: root component used top-level node shiny app id TODO app_class html class attribute app wrapper resource_path path resource folder, NULL styles inlined

title: Create an rsx UI taglist — rsx_ui
text: shiny::tagList object
